Posts.Content: Hi Jayne I'm sorry that I can't offer any advice as I have not had cording - just a seroma that was syringed, then no problems.  Just wanted to offer you a bit of support as you have been through so much, and it is often the smaller issues/side effects that get you down.  I really hope you get some physio help soon, and the cording eases.  Stay brave. Regards Sue

Posts.Content: Yep, good point.  I am not going really short, nurse says that if I get through the 1st one, you can always have a bit more taken off for second time if necessary.  My hair is already layered, but long ones.  At least with layers, you can fluff it up a little!  I think if it's coming out, it's coming out!!!  Don't fancy wigs too much, but this is a great time to buy gorgeous summer hats and pretty scarves!  Thanks for the good luck, I have been so positive - high as a kite for weeks actually, and working really hard, but had a litttle tear in my eye when I walked into the ward for the first time today - oh my God it hit hard!!  But, I will be fine.  Sue
Posts.Title: Cold Cap & Exercise

Posts.Content: Hi Saw specialist nurse today for my assessment and bloods prior to 1st FEC75 on Thursday.  Got different messages!  She said swimming pools too full of wee and bugs etc, so are steam rooms!  OK to go to gym but strongly suggested that it should be mild exercise, nothing too strenous.  Web site says avoid gym at busiest times which I guess makes sense.  I think that hospitals seem to have slightly different policies.  As you say, best thing is to be sensible, use your common sense and do what you can.  I'm pretty healthy, and want to keep fit, but am definitely being wary about catching bugs etc.  I work in a boarding school, and oncologist and nurse have both recommended that I do not return to work for the rest of my treatment unless I can do a desk job away from the kids - erm nope!!!  Was hoping to go in on the days that I felt well - bugger!

Posts.Content: Hi Great to see your reply - very encouraging!  This is a bit like being pregnant again, when you hear all of the horror stories!!  You have painted a much better picture than the worst scenario, so I feel better. Hopefully, I will be one of the lucky ones, and not be too affected by side effects etc. My oncologist said to expect to be out of it first chemo for 7-10 days, but you recovered really well.  I don't know if it is everyone, but have heard quite a lot that the day to lose your hair is day 12, if it is going, so good luck!!!  Did you get any advice about going to the gym?  I read that gyms and swimming pools are not a good idea, due to bugs etc, but I see that lots of ladies here really enjoy the benefits. I have been getting loads of exercise though, as I can't stop decorating - nothing like painting 7ft walls to get you fit!  I'm nest building ha ha!!! Keep up the info and the positivity!! Sue

Posts.Content: Hi I, too have been advised to be careful of treatments, and have had a look into it. This web site is a bit detailed, but it does answer your questions, and covers quite a few reasons why massage etc needs to be considered carefully.  There are issues such as lymphoedema, pressure on areas of weakness, due to not the cancer, but the treatments like weaked bone, blood count, and infection etc.  Knowledge is power!!!! Hope this helps Sue http://www.downeastschoolofmassage.net/forum/walton3.htm
Posts.Title: Is a massage dangerous?

Posts.Content: Thanks Tess., I guess that this is a pretty emotional time at the moment. I am certainly well informed and constantly asking and learning from the professionals,although you are well ahead of me in your knowledge. You do seem to be one of the most informed people here. The reason why I was upset I think is that I have seen other opinions and some quite reckless and dangerous  behaviour here, and I was really quite concerned for those that may have read some of these posts and thought it Ok to follow suit, especially relating to immune system issues. I also felt sad that some people make comments such as 'we are not ill', when at times some of us will be, and then you feel like you are failing if not in the gym 3 hours a day etc!! I thoroughly intend to live my life to the full,but am very aware that at times I need to rein in my behaviour and be sensible for a change!!  I worked through my entire post surgery sick leave to support the kids but now it is my time. Why is it we feel that we have to justify not being 'amazing' all of the time!! Thanks for taking the time to make me feel better!!! Sue
